p: Whatever the cause is, it is incumbent upon society to reduce the impact of the pandemic by social distancing, i.e. restriction of movement and mandatory isolation (which are more difficult to achieve in societies that are less authoritarian and the populace less obedient), effective therapies and vaccination. As far as the therapy is concerned, there have been, as of 6 April 2020, 1,277,248 documented cases with 69,570 deaths. Of the 941,217 active cases, 95% are mild and 5% are serious or critical, and it is the latter group that requires therapy beyond pure supportive measures.
